title: Convert Laboratory Water-Quality Data to SNIRH File Format
code:
# Process multiple files with error handling process_lab_files <- function(file_paths) {   results <- list()      for (file_path in file_paths) {     tryCatch({       # Read your data       lab_data <- read_your_data_function(file_path)              # Check stations first       unique_stations <- unique(lab_data$station_id)       station_status <- check_station_status(unique_stations, "surface.water")              # Filter to active stations only       active_stations <- station_status[active == TRUE, station_id]       filtered_data <- lab_data[station_id %in% active_stations]              if (nrow(filtered_data) > 0) {         # Convert filtered data         result <- convert_to_snirh(filtered_data, "surface.water")         results[[file_path]] <- result         cat("✅ Successfully processed:", file_path, "
")       } else {         cat("⚠️ No active stations in:", file_path, "
")       }            }, error = function(e) {       cat("❌ Error processing:", file_path, "-", e$message, "
")     })   }      return(results) }

title: Convert data to SNIRH file format — convert_to_snirh
text: Cleans converts laboratory data SNIRH (National Information System Water Resources) import format. handles data validation, unit conversions, station validation, formatting according SNIRH standards.

title: Convert data to SNIRH file format — convert_to_snirh
code: convert_to_snirh(data, matrix, validate_stations = NULL)

title: Convert data to SNIRH file format — convert_to_snirh
text: data data.frame data.table containing original laboratory data. Must contain following columns order: snirh_entity, station_name, station_id, sampling_date, parameter, unit, value. matrix Character string specifying type matrix processed. Must one : "surface.water" "biota". validate_stations Logical. Whether validate station IDs SNIRH database. Defaults TRUE surface.water biota matrices. Requires internet connection.

title: Convert data to SNIRH file format — convert_to_snirh
text: data.table formatted SNIRH import following structure: First row contains network specification (REDE=NETWORK_NAME) Station identifiers (ESTACAO=STATION_ID) group measurements Date/time stamps DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM format Parameter values SNIRH-compatible units symbols

title: Convert data to SNIRH file format — convert_to_snirh
text: function performs several key operations: Validates input data structure removes empty rows/columns Validates station IDs SNIRH database (surface.water biota) Checks duplicate measurements (station, date, parameter) Extracts pH temperature measurements present Converts measurement values SNIRH-compatible units Handles measurement flags (<, >, =) special values Formats output according SNIRH import specifications

title: Convert data to SNIRH file format — convert_to_snirh
text: surface.water biota matrices, function validates : station IDs exist SNIRH database stations status "ATIVA" (active) Internet connection available downloading station data validation fails, function stop provide details invalid stations need corrected database.

title: Convert data to SNIRH file format — convert_to_snirh

title: Parameter conversion table for SNIRH format — parameters

title: Parameter conversion table for SNIRH format — parameters
code: parameters

title: Parameter conversion table for SNIRH format — parameters
text: data.table 7 variables multiple rows covering water quality, sediment, biota parameters: param_lab Character. Parameter name provided laboratory. original parameter names found laboratory reports may include special characters, accents, laboratory-specific naming conventions. unit_lab Character. Unit measurement provided laboratory. represent original units used laboratory measurements may vary laboratories analytical methods. symbol_snirh Character. Standardized parameter symbol used SNIRH database. symbols unique identifiers allow consistent data storage retrieval national database. param_snirh Character. Standardized parameter name used SNIRH. names follow SNIRH conventions provide consistency across different data sources time periods. unit_snirh Character. Standardized unit used SNIRH database. measurements converted standard units ensure comparability compliance national monitoring standards. factor Numeric. Conversion factor transform laboratory units SNIRH units. formula : snirh_value = lab_value * factor. example, converting mg/L µg/L, factor 1000. sample_type Character. Type sample matrix. Valid values : water: Surface water groundwater samples biota: Biological samples (fish, plants, etc.) sediment: Sediment samples aquatic environments
